docs.text: AIRR Knowledge Schema Common data model schema for the AIRR Knowledge Commons URI: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Name: ak-schema Classes Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Assay None ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None SpecimenProcessing None CellIsolationProcessing None LibraryPreparationProcessing None NucleicAcidProcessing None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. docs.text: Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Assay None ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None SpecimenProcessing None CellIsolationProcessing None LibraryPreparationProcessing None NucleicAcidProcessing None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema is_a: Assay attributes: pcr_target: name: pcr_target description: Target locus for PCR from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: pcr_target owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string multivalued: true complete_sequences: name: complete_sequences description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: complete_sequences owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string physical_linkage: name: physical_linkage description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: physical_linkage owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string specimen: name: specimen description: The specimen that was input for an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: OBI:0000293 alias: specimen owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - SpecimenCollection - SpecimenProcessing - Assay range: Specimen specimen_processing: name: specimen_processing description: A series of zero or more specimen processing steps that precede an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: BFO:0000051 alias: specimen_processing owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay range: SpecimenProcessing multivalued: true type: name: type from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 designates_type: true alias: type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay - TCellReceptor - Epitope range: string assay_type: name: assay_type description: The specific type of an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: rdf:type alias: assay_type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay range: string target_entity_type: name: target_entity_type description: The type of the entity being measured from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: target_entity_type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay - Assessment range: string name: name: name description: A human-readable name for a thing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: schema:name alias: name owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4pcr_target: name: V1p4pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4pcr_target owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p4complete_sequences: name: V1p4complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_sequences owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CompleteSequences required: true V1p4physical_linkage: name: V1p4physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4physical_linkage owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage required: true

V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4pcr_target: name: V1p4pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4pcr_target owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p4complete_sequences: name: V1p4complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_sequences owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CompleteSequences required: true V1p4physical_linkage: name: V1p4physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4physical_linkage owner: V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage required: true

However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4locus_species owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: V1p4LocusSpecies required: false V1p4v_call: name: V1p4v_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4v_call owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement - V1p4Clone range: string V1p4d_call: name: V1p4d_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4d_call owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement - V1p4Clone range: string V1p4d2_call: name: V1p4d2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. docs.text: name: V1p4Rearrangement from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: V1p4sequence_id: name: V1p4sequence_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequence_id owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4RearrangedSequence - V1p4UnrearrangedSequence - V1p4Alignment - V1p4Rearrangement - V1p4Node range: string required: true V1p4sequence: name: V1p4sequence from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequence owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4RearrangedSequence - V1p4UnrearrangedSequence - V1p4AlleleDescription - V1p4UndocumentedAllele - V1p4Rearrangement range: string required: true V1p4quality: name: V1p4quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4quality owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: string required: false V1p4sequence_aa: name: V1p4sequence_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequence_aa owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: string required: false V1p4rev_comp: name: V1p4rev_comp annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4rev_comp owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Alignment - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean V1p4productive: name: V1p4productive annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4productive owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean required: true V1p4vj_in_frame: name: V1p4vj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4vj_in_frame owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean required: false V1p4stop_codon: name: V1p4stop_codon annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4stop_codon owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean required: false V1p4complete_vdj: name: V1p4complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_vdj owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean required: false V1p4locus: name: V1p4locus from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4locus owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4AlleleDescription - V1p4GermlineSet - V1p4Genotype - V1p4Rearrangement range: V1p4Locus V1p4locus_species: name: V1p4locus_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4locus_species owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: V1p4LocusSpecies required: false V1p4v_call: name: V1p4v_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4v_call owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement - V1p4Clone range: string V1p4d_call: name: V1p4d_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4d_call owner: V1p4Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement - V1p4Clone range: string V1p4d2_call: name: V1p4d2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. V1p4CellProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4cell_isolation: name: V1p4cell_isolation annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4cell_isolation owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4CellProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4cell_processing_protocol: name: V1p4cell_processing_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4cell_processing_protocol owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4CellProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4template_class: name: V1p4template_class annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4template_class owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4TemplateClass required: true V1p4template_quality: name: V1p4template_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4template_quality owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4template_amount: name: V1p4template_amount annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amount of template that went into the process from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4template_amount owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalQuantity required: true V1p4library_generation_method: name: V1p4library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4library_generation_method owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4LibraryGenerationMethod required: true V1p4library_generation_protocol: name: V1p4library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4library_generation_protocol owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p4library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4pcr_target: name: V1p4pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4pcr_target owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p4complete_sequences: name: V1p4complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_sequences owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CompleteSequences required: true V1p4physical_linkage: name: V1p4physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4physical_linkage owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage required: true V1p4sequencing_run_id: name: V1p4sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_run_id owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4total_reads_passing_qc_filter: name: V1p4total_reads_passing_qc_filter annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of usable reads for analysis from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4total_reads_passing_qc_filter owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p4sequencing_platform: name: V1p4sequencing_platform annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Designation of sequencing instrument used from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_platform owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_facility: name: V1p4sequencing_facility annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name and address of sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_facility owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_run_date: name: V1p4sequencing_run_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_run_date owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_kit: name: V1p4sequencing_kit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_kit owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_files: name: V1p4sequencing_files annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_files owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4SequencingData required: false

V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4LibraryGenerationMethod required: true V1p4library_generation_protocol: name: V1p4library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4library_generation_protocol owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p4library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4pcr_target: name: V1p4pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4pcr_target owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p4complete_sequences: name: V1p4complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_sequences owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CompleteSequences required: true V1p4physical_linkage: name: V1p4physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4physical_linkage owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage required: true V1p4sequencing_run_id: name: V1p4sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_run_id owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_run_date: name: V1p4sequencing_run_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_run_date owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_kit: name: V1p4sequencing_kit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_kit owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4SequencingRun - V1p4SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p4sequencing_files: name: V1p4sequencing_files annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4sequencing_files owner: V1p4SampleProcessing domain_of: - docs.text: Slot: V1p4age_event Event in the study schedule to which Age refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be sampling . For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between Age event and Sample collection time , hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity. docs.text: Slot: V1p4cell_species Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to species , in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the species information for all lower layers of the schema. URI: ak_schema:V1p4cell_species Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4CellProcessing no V1p4SampleProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4CellSpecies Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4cell_species native ak_schema:V1p4cell_species LinkML Source name: V1p4cell_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4cell_species domain_of: - V1p4CellProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CellSpecies required: false

docs.text: Slot: V1p4clone_count Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. URI: ak_schema:V1p4clone_count Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Clone no Properties Range: Integer Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4clone_count native ak_schema:V1p4clone_count LinkML Source name: V1p4clone_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4clone_count domain_of: - V1p4Clone range: integer required: false

docs.text: Slot: V1p4complete_sequences To be considered complete , the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. URI: ak_schema:V1p4complete_sequences Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4SampleProcessing no V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4CompleteSequences Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4complete_sequences native ak_schema:V1p4complete_sequences LinkML Source name: V1p4complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_sequences domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4CompleteSequences required: true
docs.title: Slot: V1p4complete_sequences

To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. docs.text: Slot: V1p4complete_vdj True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. URI: ak_schema:V1p4complete_vdj Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Rearrangement no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4complete_vdj native ak_schema:V1p4complete_vdj LinkML Source name: V1p4complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4complete_vdj domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: boolean required: false

docs.text: Slot: V1p4contributors List of individuals who contributed to the study. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The coresponding author should be listed last. docs.text: Slot: V1p4j_codon_frame Codon position of the first nucleotide in the 'coding_sequence' field. Mandatory for J genes. Not used for V or D genes. '1' means the sequence is in-frame, '2' means that the first bp is missing from the first codon, and '3' means that the first 2 bp are missing. docs.text: Slot: V1p4keywords_study Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study. docs.text: Slot: V1p4locus_species Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to organism , if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the organism information for all lower layers of the schema. URI: ak_schema:V1p4locus_species Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Rearrangement no Properties Range: V1p4LocusSpecies Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4locus_species native ak_schema:V1p4locus_species LinkML Source name: V1p4locus_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4locus_species domain_of: - V1p4Rearrangement range: V1p4LocusSpecies required: false

docs.text: Slot: V1p4pcr_target If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. docs.text: Slot: V1p4physical_linkage In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct Rearrangements before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All hetero_* terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. *_head-head refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. *_tail-head refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. *_prelinked refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). URI: ak_schema:V1p4physical_linkage Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4SampleProcessing no V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:V1p4physical_linkage native ak_schema:V1p4physical_linkage LinkML Source name: V1p4physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p4physical_linkage domain_of: - V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4SampleProcessing range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage required: true
docs.title: Slot: V1p4physical_linkage

docs.text: Slot: V1p4reactivity_method The methodology used to assess/classify reactivity. This should be either the assay utlizied in the experiment, delineated as "annotated" if annotated from an external source (e.g. IEDB), or inferred if imputed using a computational method. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: native_protein, MHC_peptide_multimer, annotated, inferred. docs.text: Slot: V1p4reactivity_readout Reactivity measurement read-out. For physical assays, this should describe what was measured. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: fluorescence_intensity, barcode_count, confidence. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_species owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: boolean required: true V1p5cell_number: name: V1p5cell_number annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_number owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5cells_per_reaction: name: V1p5cells_per_reaction annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of cells for each biological replicate from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cells_per_reaction owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5cell_storage: name: V1p5cell_storage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_storage owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: boolean required: true V1p5cell_quality: name: V1p5cell_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_quality owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5cell_isolation: name: V1p5cell_isolation annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_isolation owner: V1p5CellProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5cell_processing_protocol: name: V1p5cell_processing_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. V1p5library_generation_protocol owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p5library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5pcr_target: name: V1p5pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5pcr_target owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p5complete_sequences: name: V1p5complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5complete_sequences owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5CompleteSequences required: true V1p5physical_linkage: name: V1p5physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5physical_linkage owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PhysicalLinkage required: true

docs.text: name: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: V1p5template_class: name: V1p5template_class annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_class owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5TemplateClass required: true V1p5template_quality: name: V1p5template_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_quality owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5template_amount: name: V1p5template_amount annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amount of template that went into the process from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_amount owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: float required: true V1p5template_amount_unit: name: V1p5template_amount_unit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unit of template amount from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_amount_unit owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5TemplateAmountUnit required: true V1p5library_generation_method: name: V1p5library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_method owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5LibraryGenerationMethod required: true V1p5library_generation_protocol: name: V1p5library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_protocol owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p5library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5pcr_target: name: V1p5pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5pcr_target owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p5complete_sequences: name: V1p5complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5complete_sequences owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5CompleteSequences required: true V1p5physical_linkage: name: V1p5physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5physical_linkage owner: V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PhysicalLinkage required: true

Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5quality owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement range: boolean required: true V1p5vj_in_frame: name: V1p5vj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5vj_in_frame owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement range: boolean required: false V1p5complete_vdj: name: V1p5complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5complete_vdj owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement range: boolean required: false V1p5locus: name: V1p5locus from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5locus owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5AlleleDescription - V1p5GermlineSet - V1p5Genotype - V1p5Rearrangement range: V1p5Locus V1p5v_call: name: V1p5v_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5v_call owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement - V1p5Clone range: string V1p5d_call: name: V1p5d_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5d_call owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement - V1p5Clone range: string V1p5d2_call: name: V1p5d2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5d2_call owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement range: string required: false V1p5j_call: name: V1p5j_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5j_call owner: V1p5Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p5Rearrangement - V1p5Clone range: string V1p5c_call: name: V1p5c_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Constant region gene with allele. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_species owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5CellSpecies required: false V1p5single_cell: name: V1p5single_cell annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5single_cell owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: boolean required: true V1p5cell_number: name: V1p5cell_number annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_number owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5cells_per_reaction: name: V1p5cells_per_reaction annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of cells for each biological replicate from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cells_per_reaction owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5cell_storage: name: V1p5cell_storage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_storage owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: boolean required: true V1p5cell_quality: name: V1p5cell_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_quality owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5cell_isolation: name: V1p5cell_isolation annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_isolation owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5cell_processing_protocol: name: V1p5cell_processing_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5cell_processing_protocol owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5CellProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5template_class: name: V1p5template_class annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_class owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5TemplateClass required: true V1p5template_quality: name: V1p5template_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_quality owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5template_amount: name: V1p5template_amount annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amount of template that went into the process from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_amount owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: float required: true V1p5template_amount_unit: name: V1p5template_amount_unit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unit of template amount from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5template_amount_unit owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5TemplateAmountUnit required: true V1p5library_generation_method: name: V1p5library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_method owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5LibraryGenerationMethod required: true V1p5library_generation_protocol: name: V1p5library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_protocol owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p5library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5pcr_target: name: V1p5pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5pcr_target owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p5complete_sequences: name: V1p5complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5complete_sequences owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5CompleteSequences required: true V1p5physical_linkage: name: V1p5physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5physical_linkage owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PhysicalLinkage required: true V1p5sequencing_run_id: name: V1p5sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_run_id owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter: name: V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of usable reads for analysis from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5sequencing_platform: name: V1p5sequencing_platform annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Designation of sequencing instrument used from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_platform owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5sequencing_facility: name: V1p5sequencing_facility annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name and address of sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_facility owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5sequencing_run_date: name: V1p5sequencing_run_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_run_date owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5sequencing_kit: name: V1p5sequencing_kit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_kit owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5sequencing_files: name: V1p5sequencing_files annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_files owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5SequencingData required: false

V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5TemplateAmountUnit required: true V1p5library_generation_method: name: V1p5library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_method owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5LibraryGenerationMethod required: true V1p5library_generation_protocol: name: V1p5library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_protocol owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5library_generation_kit_version: name: V1p5library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5pcr_target: name: V1p5pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5pcr_target owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true V1p5complete_sequences: name: V1p5complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5complete_sequences owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5CompleteSequences required: true V1p5physical_linkage: name: V1p5physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5physical_linkage owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p5SampleProcessing range: V1p5PhysicalLinkage required: true V1p5sequencing_run_id: name: V1p5sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_run_id owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: string required: true V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter: name: V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of usable reads for analysis from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p5SequencingRun - V1p5SampleProcessing range: integer required: true V1p5sequencing_platform: name: V1p5sequencing_platform annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Designation of sequencing instrument used from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: V1p5sequencing_platform owner: V1p5SampleProcessing domain_of: -
